title: [Large-scale] Constructivist English Collaborative Education Program for Academic Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level English proficiency and awareness of college academic preparedness requirements
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment for adult ESL learners preparing for U.S. university admission, focusing on academic English proficiency development

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to analyze academic papers and lecture materials to identify and summarize key concepts.

Learners can deliver a 5-minute presentation or participate in a 10-minute discussion using logical English expressions (e.g., connectors, evidence presentation, counterargument construction) in academic presentations and discussions, achieving 4+ points (out of 5) in at least four out of five rubric criteria (clarity, logic, fluency, interaction, language accuracy).

Learners write three academic papers (essays, reports) using a peer review system, incorporate feedback, and submit a final report achieving ≥80% structural completeness (clarity of introduction-body-conclusion, logical flow) and ≥90% linguistic accuracy (grammar, vocabulary, style).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
